column4: how does one tell synaptic that one wishes it to install security updates?
the manual seems chock-full of manual package management stuff
I install things with aptitude install, and install updates when prompted to do so
try clicking options > repositories; then the third tab or something you can choose what updates it installs
and you can choose on other tabs where to get updates from
for example you can turn on backports
I don't know where ubuntu wants me to install updates from
I'm happy to trust the ubuntu people as to which packages it's sensible to update
but it seems aptitude doesn't want to tell me
(I'm on kubuntu at home, so can't just click the orange icon that pops up on ubuntu proper)
so what am I supposed to do with a list of repositories?
ok jjlee open synaptic; click settings then repositories; then click updates; then under Automatic updates tick "check for updates" every X days; then "only notify about updates" or whatever
there is no updates button in the repositories dialog that I can see
